alert.note: Alert for Brooks (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 12 at 4:19PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Jefferson, western Madison and southwestern Brooks Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 419 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles north of Monticello to 18 miles west of Madison. Movement was east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Monticello, Quitman, Madison, Greenville, Barwick, Alma, Dills, Grooverville, Ebb, Lamont, Hamburg, Eridu, Lovett, Empress, Brooks Co A/p, Sirmans, Dixie, Moseley Hall, Hopewell and Aucilla. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
